keyPolicies.policyDescription: Glasgow Central voted to remain in the EU by over 71%. We didn't vote for Boris Johnson's Brexit. As your MP I have voted consistently against a damaging Tory Brexit which would be catastrophic for jobs and living standards here in Glasgow Central.

As your MP I have made a stand against callous Tory austerity measures, particularly their cruel welfare cuts. I have worked to ensure that over £75,000 of unpaid social security has gone into the pockets of those who needed it the most. I have also led the fight against the horrendous rape clause and two child limit and I won't rest until it is scrapped.

Residents of Glasgow Central have had to put up with the misuse of fireworks and related anti-social behavior for too long. I have been pushing for more restrictions on the sale of fireworks. So far, the UK Government hasn't been keen to act. That is why I am calling for control over the sale of fireworks to be devolved to the Scottish Parliament.

As an MP, and previously as a local Councillor, I have seen the impact that drug use has on communities. In Glasgow Central, people are taking drugs in unsafe conditions. The Tories have opposed overdose prevention services like supervised drug consumption rooms for ideological reasons. I will continue to argue for an evidence based approach which will reduce harm and save lives.

endorsements.endorsement: The parliament at Westminster no longer has anything to offer the people of Scotland. This election is the opportunity to demand that Scotland has the right to choose a better future. This is our chance to make our voice heard.
